    • Method Detail

      • readBasicUserData

        public java.util.List<Triplet<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String,​java.time.LocalDateTime>> readBasicUserData()
                                                                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reads basic user data from csv storage file.
        Returns:
        a list of tuples of three elements, corresponding to the username, password, and banUntil properties of the read user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when storage file paths are not found.

      • readAdminUserData

        public java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>> readAdminUserData()
                                                                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Reads admin user data from csv storage file.
        Returns:
        a list of key-value entries, each one corresponding to the username and password of the admin user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when storage file paths are not found.

      • readEventData

        public java.util.List<Triplet<java.lang.String,​java.time.LocalDateTime,​java.lang.String>> readEventData()
                                                                                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Read event data from csv storage file.
        Returns:
        a list of three value tuples, each one corresponding to the user, date-time, and type of each event, respectively.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when storage file paths are not found.

      • readWalletData

        public java.util.List<SerializedWallet> readWalletData()
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        reads wallet data from file
        Returns:
        a list of serialized Wallet objects
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file path is invalid

      • readArtData

        public java.util.List<SerializedArt> readArtData()
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads arts data and readies it
        Returns:
        a List of SerializedArt objects
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file path is invalid
